verses.verse: My beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see if they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
This is how you can recognize the Spirit of God; every spirit that freely admits that Christ has come in flesh is from God.

And every spirit that does not freely admit that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God, and this is that spirit of antichrist, which you have heard would come, and even now is already in the world.
Little children, you are of God and overcome them, because he who is in you is greater that he who is in the world.
They are of the world; therefore they speak the world's way, and the world listens to them.
We are of God. He who knows God listens to us; he who is not of God does not listen to us. By this, we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.
Beloved let us love one another, because love is from God, and everyone who loves is born of God and knows God.
He who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
God's love towards us is clearly seen by this, because God sent his only begotten Son into the world, so that we might live through him.
Now this is love: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Beloved, if God loved us this much, we have to love one another, too.
No one has ever seen God. If we love one another, God lives in us, and his love is made complete in us.
We know by this that we live in him, and he in us, because he has given us his Spirit.
We have seen and testify that the Father sent out the Son to be the Savior of the world.
Whoever will freely admit that Jesus is the Son of God, God lives in him, and he in God.
We have known and believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and he who lives in love, lives in God and God in him.
By this our love is made complete, so we can have confidence on Judgment Day, because just as He is, we [who are] in this world are also.
There is no fear in love, on the contrary, perfected love throws out fear, because fear has torment, and the fearful is not perfected in love.
We love him, because he loved us first.
If anyone says, "I love God," yet hates his brother, is a liar, for how can he say he loves God who he can't see and doesn't love his brother who he can see?
And this is the commandment we have from him that the one who loves God love his brother also.
